title.narrative: The Equal Rights Trust Sudan and South S 2012-2014
The Equal Rights Trust Sudan and South S 2012-2014

description.narrative: Stöd till Equal Rights Trust i syfte att skapa större mångfald i media i Sudan och Sydsudan genom att bl.a. öka friheten för journalister, oberoende medier och andra som använder sociala medier. Vidare syftar insatser till att öka kapaciteten bland MR- försvarare.

Support to Equal Rights Trust in order to create more diversity in the media in Sudan and South Sudan, through the increase of freedom for journalists, independent media, and others who use social media. Furthermore the support aims at increasing the capacity of human rights defenders.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative:
General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2014Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The results achieved during the project's three years are in line with the intended and added objectives and outcomes for the project. Sida agrees with ERT that the succesfull implementation of the planned activities has improved and increased the technical and material capacity of Human Rights Defenders and the media, and has also increased the suistainabilty of independent human rights journalism in Sudan and South Sudan.
During 2014 Sida agreed to extend the support to ERT with one additional year, including additional budget of 1,5 MSEK. The purpose was to allow ERT to effect a responsible withdrawal and ensure the sustainability of the within the project period established Sudan Journalists for Human Rights Network (SJHR). This would be achieved through establishing a SJHR secretariat in the form of an independent non-governmental organisation. Which ERT proudly reports has been established and achieved according to the plan.
The report presents many important and highly relevant results that have been achieved in accordance with the agreed results framework. The majority of the presented results are at output level, however clearly linked to the overall objective and to the results areas specified above. Sida believes that the many and relevant activities undertaken contributed to achieving the project’s outcome: Increasing the technical and material capacity of human rights defenders (HRDs) and the media in both Sudan and South Sudan to defend the rights to freedom of expression and equality through advocacy and awareness- raising. ERT reports that they have achieved all planned results successfully and that the third additional year enabled further progress in the original five outcome areas exceeding ERT´s expectations (additional to the sustainable achievement of the NGO-result). ERT reports the achievements through thorough presentation on specific activities and outcomes. The responsible unit at Sida has not been able to follow up the project in the field and therefore is only able to assess the submitted reports with follow up questions through email and phone. Additionally, the regular dialogue with ERT during the project period has supported Sida in the assessment of the progresses made by ERT.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
